Term.Name: Preproduction
Term.Definition: The preliminary planning and preparation before the production.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: Production
Term.Definition: The process of filming and recording the raw footage of a movie.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: Postproduction
Term.Definition: The processing and assembling of the raw footage to a final product. Additional material like VFX, Sound Effects and Music may be added.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: Audio
Term.Definition: Audio related postproduction steps.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: ProductionSoundEditing
Term.Definition: Editing and splitting of original dialogue and production effects.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: ADR
Term.Definition: Recording of unusable dialogue usually with the original actors in a studio environment.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: AdrTakeListPreparation
Term.Definition: Creation of a take list, including all dialogue parts which need to be replaced.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: AdrRecording
Term.Definition: Recording of the marked dialogue takes.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: AdrEditing
Term.Definition: Editing of the recorded ADR.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: Dubbing
Term.Definition: Recording of the translated dialogue for foreign distribution.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: DubbingTranslation
Term.Definition: Translation of the original dialogue into the foreign language.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: DubbingRecording
Term.Definition: Recording of the translated dialogue.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: DubbingEditing
Term.Definition: Editing of the recorded dubbed dialogue.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: FieldRecordings
Term.Definition: Recording of sounds outside of a studio environment e.g. ambient sounds.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: FieldRecordingRec
Term.Definition: Recording of sounds outside of a studio environment e.g. ambient sounds.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: FieldRecordingEditing
Term.Definition: Editing of fieldrecordings.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: Foleys
Term.Definition: Recording of sounds in a studio environment, mostly for character related sound events like footsteps and movements.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: FoleyPreparation
Term.Definition: Creation of marker tracks, including all timestemps which need some foley sounds.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: FoleyRecording
Term.Definition: Recording of foley sounds.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: FoleyEditing
Term.Definition: Editing of foley sounds.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: Sounddesign
Term.Definition: Assembling and merging of all non-dialoge sounds.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: BackgroundEffects
Term.Definition: Adding sounds for background events.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: SpotEffects
Term.Definition: Adding sounds visible events.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: AmbientDesign
Term.Definition: Adding sounds for static environmental layers.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: SoundEffectsGenerated
Term.Definition: Generating sound effects by a hard- or software tool.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: SoundEffectsFromLibrary
Term.Definition: Adding sound effects from a library.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: SoundEffectsEditing
Term.Definition: Editing of sound effects.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: Music
Term.Definition: Creating and seeking of music.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: Score
Term.Definition: Music which does not occur inside the plot and is only perceptible for the audience.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: ScoreComposing
Term.Definition: Composition of the score music usually by a film composer.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: ScoreRecording
Term.Definition: Recording of the composed score.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: ScoreEditing
Term.Definition: Editing of the recorded score.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: ScoreMixing
Term.Definition: Mixing the recorded and edited score.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: ScoreMusicResearch
Term.Definition: Researching for possible score songs or temporary music in a library or other types of music distribution services.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: Source
Term.Definition: Music which occurence is embedded inside the plot of the movie e.g. music from a radio.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: SourceComposing
Term.Definition: Composition of the source music usually by a film composer.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: SourceRecording
Term.Definition: Recording of the composed source.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: SourceEditing
Term.Definition: Editing of the recorded source.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: SourceMixing
Term.Definition: Mixing the recorded and edited source.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: SourceMusicResearch
Term.Definition: Researching for possible source songs or temporary music in a library or other types of music distribution services.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: CuesheetPreparation
Term.Definition: Listing all needed music tracks.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: Mixing
Term.Definition: Mixing of all or a specific selection of tracks.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: MixingDataAcquisition
Term.Definition: Collecting and preparing all needed sounds in one session in order to proceed with the mixing steps.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: Premix
Term.Definition: Preparation and premixing of a specific group of sounds.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: PremixDialogue
Term.Definition: Preparing and adjusting all dialogue parts in order to accelerate the main mix.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: PremixEffects
Term.Definition: Preparing and adjusting all effect parts in order to accelerate the main mix.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: PremixMusic
Term.Definition: Preparing and adjusting all the musical parts in order to accelerate the main mix.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: TheatricalMix
Term.Definition: Mix of all kinds of sound for distribution to cinemas, usually at least in 5.1 surround.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: TrailerMix
Term.Definition: Mix of all types of sound except the music in order to assemble a film trailer which has its own music.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: TelevisionMix
Term.Definition: Mix of all kinds of sound for distribution to broadcast companies, usually in stereo and/or 5.1.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: MneMix
Term.Definition: Mix of a specific selection of groups, usually without dialogue and location restricted music.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: ImpairedMix
Term.Definition: Mix for an impaired audience.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: DubbedMix
Term.Definition: Mix of the dubbed dialogue and an MnE-Mix.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: FinalMixAcceptance
Term.Definition: Acceptance of the MainMix by the director or other production members.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: CuesheetsFilling
Term.Definition: Supplementing the Cuesheets for each mix with the final timecodes.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: Video
Term.Definition: Video related postproduction steps.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: Dailies
Term.Definition: Processing the daily raw footage as soon as possible.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: DailiesGrading
Term.Definition: Color grading of the daily raw footage as soon as possible.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: DailiesAudioVideoSync
Term.Definition: Syncing audio and video while the dailies process
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: DailiesQC
Term.Definition: Checking the technical and content-related properties e.g. metadata, integrity, acuity, framing
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: AssistingFilmEditing
Term.Definition: Vorbereitung des Schnitt-Projekts
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: AssisingFilmEditAudioVideoSync
Term.Definition: Syncing audio and video by the assistent editor
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: EditingProjectPreparation
Term.Definition: Preparing the editing project for the editor
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: PictureEditing
Term.Definition: Assembling multiple Shots on a timeline usually with proxy files.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: PictureLock
Term.Definition: Final version of the edited timeline.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: Conforming
Term.Definition: Transferring the final editing timeline into the grading system. Relinking of the raw footage.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: PreVfxQc
Term.Definition: Check for lenght, format, colour space and contentwise errors before sending the raw footage to the VFX department.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: VFX
Term.Definition: The process by which imagery is created or manipulated outside the context of a live action shot.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: PostVfxQc
Term.Definition: Check for lenght, format, colour space and contentwise errors of the returned VFX shots.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: Title
Term.Definition: Creating textual titles which appear on screen.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: Front Titles
Term.Definition: Titles that appear at the beginning of a movie, usually to introduce the most significant cast and the film title.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: End Titles
Term.Definition: Titles that appear at the end of a movie, usually to credit all cast members grouped by their role. Also called "Credits".
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: InsertTitles
Term.Definition: Titles that occur e.g. in a scene change to introduce a new Location ("Berlin, Alexanderplatz") or to introduce a character by a title.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: Subtitles
Term.Definition: Textual titles that include all spoken dialogue in the original or a foreign language. Can be open or closed (as a separate source or burned into the video).
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: Captions
Term.Definition: Textual titles that include all spoken dialogue and descriptions for significant noises and music in the original or a foreign language. Can be open or closed (as a separate source or burned into the video).
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: Grading
Term.Definition: Creating a visual look for each scene in order to create a certain mood or continuity (shot matching).
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: Playouts
Term.Definition: Render the whole movie as a consolidated video file
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: CinemaPlayout
Term.Definition: A render version supposed to be watched in a cinematic environment.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: CinemaPlayoutSDR
Term.Definition: A render version supposed to be watched in a cinematic environment with a standard dynamic range.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: CinemaPlayoutHDR
Term.Definition: A render version supposed to be watched in a cinematic environment with a high dynamic range.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: CinemaPlayoutXYZ
Term.Definition: A render version supposed to be watched in a cinematic environment with the colour space "XYZ" which is used for beamer projections.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: TVPlayout
Term.Definition: A render version supposed to be published by broadcast companies.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: TVPlayoutHDR
Term.Definition: A render version supposed to be published by broadcast companies with a standard dynamic range.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: TVPlayoutSDR
Term.Definition: A render version supposed to be published by broadcast companies with a high dynamic range.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: PreviewPlayout
Term.Definition: A render version supposed to act as a preview in a low resolution e.g. for a fast online transfer.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: Mastering
Term.Definition: Final merging of audio and video
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: DcpMastering
Term.Definition: Creation of a Digital Cinema Package which contains a necessary audio and video files to be played in a cinema.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: DvdMastering
Term.Definition: Creation of a Print Master for the DVD release.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: BluRayMastering
Term.Definition: Creation of a Print Master for the Blu-Ray release.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: HomeCinemaMastering
Term.Definition: Creation of a Master for Home Cinemas
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: DCDM
Term.Definition: Creation of a Digital Cinema Initiative Distribution Master
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: FormalAccommodations
Term.Definition: Final accommodations for audio and video files.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: AudioMixAccommodations
Term.Definition: Final accommodations for audio files.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: PitchCorrection
Term.Definition: Changing the pitch of an audio mix in order to correct changes that occur when changing the lengh of the mix.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: Timestretch
Term.Definition: Changing the lengh of a mix in order to adjust it to a different framerate.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: ChannelFormatConversion
Term.Definition: Creating generic downmixes or splitting in multiple mono channels.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: LoudnessAdjustment
Term.Definition: Adjusting the loundness of a mix in order to match the demanded technical specifications.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: FinalVideoAccommodations
Term.Definition: Final accommodations for video files.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: FrameRateConversion
Term.Definition: Changing the frame rate in order to enable the distribution for different countries and types of publishing e.g. cinema in 24fps, european TV in 25 fps, US-American TV in 29.97fps
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: ScanAndPan
Term.Definition: Adjusting the position of each video clip when the desired aspect ratio differs from the recorded aspect ratio.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: FinalQualityCheck
Term.Definition: Technical check of the final products for clicks or flaws from rendering.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: Delivery
Term.Definition: The final product goes to the customer or other institutions like film distributors or broadcast companies.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: Release
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: Archiving
Term.Definition: Long-Term storing of the final products and related auxillary data in a maintained system.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: RightsManagement
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project
